meanings.definition: A device used to store electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The small capacitor in the flashlight stores energy.
meanings.sent2: The technician replaced the old capacitor in the circuit board.
meanings.sent3: The capacitor and the battery had a race to see who could hold the most charge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a capacitor, always ready to store new information.
meanings.sent5: The capacitor hummed softly as it filled with electricity.

meanings.definition: A component in an electronic circuit that stores energy in an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The capacitor helped regulate the flow of electricity in the device.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to discharge the capacitor before working on the circuit.
meanings.sent3: The capacitor and the resistor were best friends, always working together.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a charged capacitor, ready to light up the room.
meanings.sent5: The capacitor acted like a sponge, soaking up all the excess energy.

meanings.definition: A device that consists of two conductive plates separated by an insulating material.
meanings.sent1: The capacitor in the radio had metal plates inside.
meanings.sent2: The engineer carefully assembled the capacitor for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The capacitor and the wire played hide and seek behind the desk.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a capacitor, holding onto memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The capacitor was like a bridge, connecting the two sides of the circuit.
